image.altText: A man with shaggy dark hair and blue eyes reclines in a chair

props.synopsis: Once dismissed as "the Paris Hilton of Canadian politics", Justin Trudeau defied expectations by holding onto power for almost a decade. But his tumultuous period in office was often defined by scandals of his own making.

title.children: Trudeau entered office with his wife and best friend. He left politics alone

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie as he looks to his side while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: US president-elect Donald Trump refuses to rule out using the military to seize control of Greenland and the Panama Canal.

title.children: Trump refuses to rule out using military to seize Greenland and Panama Canal

image.altText: City office-workers and passers-by watch the ASX board in Sydney

props.synopsis: A fall on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower, while the Bureau of Statistics is set to release monthly inflation data that is expected to show core inflation remains above the Reserve Bank's 2–3 per cent target band. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX falls as monthly inflation set to tick higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CBA forecasts inflation to rise to 2.6% in November
Chalmers says inflation 'is now within the Reserve Bank's target range'

image.altText: Rottnest Island crashed seaplane

props.synopsis: Three people are missing after a plane crash on Rottnest Island, prompting an investigation by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau.

title.children: Three seriously injured, three missing after Rottnest Island plane crash

image.altText: Rescuers pull parts of a plane wreck onto a boat ramp

props.synopsis: Three people who were on a seaplane that crashed into the Indian Ocean near Perth remain missing and three others are recovering in hospital.

title.children: What do we know about the Rottnest Island seaplane crash?

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios walks with a backpack on

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios is in doubt for the Australian Open after pulling out of a pre-tournament exhibition match against Novak Djokovic due to grade one abdominal strain.

title.children: Nick Kyrgios in doubt for Australian Open

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, standing on a stage, wearing a black t-shirt, talking at a company conference.

props.synopsis: Mark Zuckerberg says fact checkers have been "too politically biased" and that community notes similar to those on X will be rolled out to platforms such as Facebook.

title.children: Facebook to end fact checking and 'work with Trump' against censorship

image.altText: A man wearing high vis, a safety helmet and blue overalls looks up at a stack of large shipping containers.

props.synopsis: The cold chain process is a little understood part of our food supply chain. It changed how and what we eat today.

title.children: Creating ice stumped many, until an Australian discovered a commercial fix

image.altText: An Australian Army bushmaster with a red cross painted on the side in a military training field area near Adelaide in 2016.

props.synopsis: The federal government has ordered another 40 Bendigo-built Bushmaster Protected Mobility Vehicles in a contract valued at more than $100 million, as part of ongoing expansion of the army.

title.children: Australia commits $100m to boost stock of world's 'best' armoured truck

image.altText: woman with short hair smiles

props.synopsis: A British minister who Elon Musk has described as a "rape genocide apologist" says the US billionaire knows "absolutely nothing" about the child sexual abuse scandals he has been commenting on.

title.children: British minister says Musk knows 'nothing' about child rape scandals

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Most experts are predicting Australian home prices will keep falling in early 2025. But the news isn't great for would-be buyers, with the decline expected to be small and short-lived.

title.children: Australian home prices tipped to keep falling in early 2025

image.altText: A map of Melbourne demonstrating the amount of social housing funding that has been allocated to each local government area.

props.synopsis: A $5.3 billion fund — billed as the nation's largest-ever investment by a state government in social housing — was rolled out in Victoria four years ago. Now questions are being asked about where the money's being spent.

title.children: Victoria has tipped billions into social housing — here's where it's going

image.altText: Smoke rises from a wildfire burning near Pacific Palisades on the west side of Los Angeles during a weather driven windstorm.

props.synopsis: A fast-moving wildfire in Los Angeles, whipping up by "life threatening" winds, has burned buildings and sparked evacuations.

title.children: Thousands of LA residents under evacuation orders as wind drives blaze

image.altText: A fire in bush at night.

props.synopsis: Victorian firefighters bring a bushfire at Cape Otway under control, after some campers were evacuated in the early hours of Wednesday morning.

title.children: Cape Otway bushfire that threatened campers slowed 'for now'

image.altText: A swarm of black fish part to making way for a grey shark swimming through.

props.synopsis: Shark attacks have steadily risen over time as more people enter the water, but one shark researcher says the likelihood of being bitten is still "exceptionally low".

title.children: Not all shark attacks are random and you can take steps to reduce risk

image.altText: Drinks and snacks on a table in an office environment, people in office attire in the background

props.synopsis: Ratepayers are footing the alcohol bill for NSW councillors' post-meeting drinks despite the state government's best practice policy excluding it.

title.children: Ratepayers slugged for NSW council alcohol purchases

image.altText: A woman in a pink jumper holds a bunch of toilet paper rolls

props.synopsis: Do you know how many toilet rolls we each use a year? Or why some paper has patterns on it? Test your knowledge and find out in our quiz.

title.children: Bog roll, loo paper, whatever you say, test your toilet paper knowledge

image.altText: An older man with dyed blond hair and a bronzed face grits his teeth behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: A New York court denies president-elect Donald Trump's latest bid to delay this week's sentencing in his hush money case.

title.children: New York court rejects latest Trump bid to halt hush money sentencing

image.altText: A destroyed house surrounding by building debris

props.synopsis: Chinese state media said the quake struck China's Dingri county at the foot of Mount Everest and was felt as far away as neighbouring Nepal and parts of India.

title.children: At least 126 killed as magnitude-6.8 earthquake hits China's Tibet region

image.altText: Police cars parked in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A two-year-old boy reported missing in south-east Queensland overnight has been found safe.

title.children: Missing two-year-old boy found safe

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic hits a shot

props.synopsis: As a wildcard entry, local Ajla Tomljanović will hope for a kind start when the Australian Open draw is announced on Thursday.

title.children: Tomljanović an early threat to Australian Open rivals

image.altText: Emerson Jones of Australia celebrates a point in her match against Xinyu Wang.

props.synopsis: Queensland teenager Emerson Jones is the world number one junior girls player and has already impressed a grand slam champion at just 16. Here's what to expect of her grand slam debut.

title.children: The Aussie teen who's already impressed a grand slam champ

image.altText: An older man kneels on the brick-lined kerb of a suburban road.

props.synopsis: Four men including the landowner laid down Lapstone's red brick kerbs and they haven't changed in 70 years.

title.children: The two distinctive things that make these Blue Mountains streets stand out

image.altText: A young woman drinking a shake in a park before going for a run.

props.synopsis: If you've vowed to hit the gym in 2025, you may encounter "pre-workouts": powders promising bulked-up muscles and increased endurance. We look at the evidence behind their claims.

title.children: Do 'pre-workout' powders help you get stronger faster?

image.altText: Jai Opetaia and David Nyika go head-to-head

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia defends his IBF and The Ring cruiserweight world titles against David Nyika at the Gold Coast Convention and Exhibition Centre on Wednesday night.

title.children: How to watch Opetaia fight Nyika for world cruiserweight title

image.altText: two men standing on a boat, looking out to the side, there is a fishing rope in view

props.synopsis: Jelly blubbers are overwhelming the Hawkesbury River and some say harvesting them for sale as a delicacy may be the solution.

title.children: Jellyfish 'boom' swamping river forces fishermen to get second jobs

image.altText: Jean-Marie Le Pen sitting at a press conference, with a Le Pen logo behind him in the colours of the French flag.

props.synopsis: Le Pen founded the populist and Eurosceptic political party National Front, which is now led by his daughter and is the largest party in France's parliament.

title.children: Prominent far-right French politician Jean-Marie Le Pen dies

image.altText: A shot of still ocean water and a white sandy beach lined with palm trees.

props.synopsis: Health professionals fear vaccine conspiracies and COVID-19 disruptions could be partly responsible for a spike in measles cases in countries including Vietnam and Thailand.

title.children: Measles outbreaks in South-East Asia bringing cases to Australia

image.altText: A close up of an open cotton flower

props.synopsis: After years planting cotton, a growing region has built up a soil pest that sucks the life out of crops — but there may be a solution on the horizon.

title.children: Farmers trial sunn hemp to save cotton crops in Queensland

image.altText: protestors hold south korean flags supporting president yoon

props.synopsis: The Corruption Investigation Office for High-Ranking Officials has not confirmed how long the warrant would remain valid.

title.children: South Korean court re-issues arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon

image.altText: A person pouring coffee and milk into a white coffee cup to make latte art.

props.synopsis: Barista alternative milks claim to be better for coffee. But are they much different or is simply marketing?

title.children: Is it worth paying more for alternative milk designed for coffee?

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: Police say camera gear and a lighter thought to belong to missing hiker Hadi Nazari have been found at a campfire site in the Kosciuszko National Park.

title.children: Fresh clues found as search continues for hiker missing in Snowy Mountains

image.altText: Ken Randall chairing a discussion at the National Press Club

props.synopsis: The highly respected journalist was also, at 22 years, the longest-serving president of the National Press Club (NPC) in Canberra, where he was patron from 2016 until his death on Monday evening.

title.children: Veteran political journalist and ABC host Ken Randall dies aged 88

image.altText: William Yang Milestone

props.synopsis: William Yang, one of Australia's leading artists, celebrates his eight-decade life in a new show premiering at Sydney Festival.

title.children: Meet the 81-year-old who photographed the birth of Sydney's gay culture
